page.title: 06Counting Out Rhymes, Knowle
page.content: A survey was made of counting out ryhmes (dips) at Bentley Heath School near Knowle in May 1985 to see which age groups used them to decide a child to be "on" or "it" in a game. The youngest class (4-5 years) were too young to use them. About half of Class 2 (5-6) years) used them whereas in Class 3 (6-7 years) nearly all of the cildren used them. The situation was the same in the 1st and 2nd Year Junior classes (8 and 9 years). About half of the 3rd Year Junior classes (10 years) used them and hardly any of the 4th Year children (11 years) did. In the top 2 years the children arranged who was "on" by negotiation. One example of a dip is as follows: "Eeny, Meeny, Mackeracka, Ominacka, Ominacka, Om, pom, push!".
